title: Proverbs Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Proverbs with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 31 chapters.

questions.question: Who is traditionally credited as the author of the proverbs in the book of Proverbs?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 1:1 states that the proverbs are of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel.

questions.question: What is described as the beginning of knowledge?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 1:7 teaches that the fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.

questions.question: In Proverbs 3:5, what are we instructed to do with all our heart?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5 says, "Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding."

questions.question: According to Proverbs 6:6, what example does the wise man give for diligence?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 6:6 encourages learning from the ant's diligent preparation.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs teaches that a soft answer turns away wrath.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:1 clearly states, "A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger."

questions.question: What is more precious than rubies according to Proverbs 8:11?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 8:11 says, "For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it."

questions.question: Who is spoken of as 'the words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him'?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:1 identifies these words as those of king Lemuel taught by his mother.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not ______ from it.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:6 states that a child trained in the right way will not depart from it when grown.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 15:3, what does the LORD's eyes behold?
options: Every place, the evil and the good
questions.correctAnswer: Every place, the evil and the good
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:3 says, "The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good."

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 10:22, the blessing of the LORD makes rich without sorrow.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 10:22 states, "The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it."

questions.question: What is the instruction given in Proverbs 1:10 to the son concerning sinners?
options: Consent not if sinners entice thee
questions.correctAnswer: Consent not if sinners entice thee
questions.explanation: Proverbs 1:10 warns: "My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not."

questions.question: Which virtue does Proverbs 31:30 highlight as better than beauty?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:30 states, "The fear of the LORD is to be praised."

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3:9 teaches to honor the LORD with thy substance and firstfruits of all thine increase.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:9 instructs honoring the LORD with substance and firstfruits.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 11:25, what will happen to the liberal soul?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:25 says, "The liberal soul shall be made fat."

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The fear of the LORD is the instruction of ______; and before honour is humility.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:33 states this explicitly.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 4:23 say to keep above all things?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 4:23 instructs to keep thy heart with all diligence.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 18:21 teaches that the tongue has the power of life and death.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 18:21 states, "Death and life are in the power of the tongue."

questions.question: In Proverbs 22:1, what is said to be better than great riches?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 teaches that a good name is rather to be chosen than great riches.

questions.question: What punishment does Proverbs 6:16-19 list as abominations to the LORD?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 6:16-19 lists six things the LORD hates, including pride, lying, and violence.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the ______ is broken.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:13 teaches this contrast.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:4 advises not to wear thyself out to get rich.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:4 warns against weariness in pursuit of riches.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 10:12, what covereth all sins?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 10:12 states, "Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins."

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 14:1 teaches that a wise woman builds her house.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 14:1 states, "The wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands."

questions.question: Who is described as one who 'watches daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors' in Proverbs 8?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 8:34 describes the blessed man who listens daily for wisdom.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'A soft answer turneth away ______: but grievous words stir up anger.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:1 states this truth about speech.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 28:13, what happens to him that confesseth and forsaketh his sins?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 28:13 teaches that confessing and forsaking sin leads to mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 27:17 says 'Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 27:17 uses this analogy to describe mutual improvement.

questions.question: What is the reward for a diligent man according to Proverbs 22:29?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:29 states a diligent man shall stand before kings.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 17:22 says 'A merry heart doeth good like a medicine.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 17:22 compares a merry heart to good medicine.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 12:1, who loves correction?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 12:1 teaches that he who loves correction is wise.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Pride goeth before ______, and a haughty spirit before a fall.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 16:18 warns of the consequences of pride.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20:1 says that wine is a mocker and strong drink is raging.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:1 teaches this about wine and strong drink.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 11:24 say about such as give liberally?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 11:24 says, "There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty."

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 14:12 says, 'There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 14:12 warns against trusting in man's seeming rightness.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:17, what does he that hath pity upon the poor do?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:17 says, "He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD."

questions.question: What does Proverbs 13:20 say about him that walketh with wise men?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 13:20 states that walking with wise men makes one wise.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:7 says 'As he thinketh in his heart, so is he.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:7 teaches that our thoughts shape who we are.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The lips of the wise disperse ______.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:7 says, "The lips of the wise disperse knowledge."

questions.question: What does Proverbs 27:1 warn against?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 27:1 warns against boasting of the future, as it is uncertain.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 29:18 declares that where there is no vision, the people perish.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 29:18 teaches the importance of vision and revelation.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:9, what is better than a contentious woman in a house?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:9 states it is better to dwell in a corner of a housetop than with a contentious woman.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 24:16 says that a just man falleth seven times and riseth up again.
questions.explanation: Proverbs 24:16 teaches the resilience of the righteous.

questions.question: What is said about he that refuseth instruction in Proverbs 15:32?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:32 says he that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of ______ feedeth on foolishness.'
questions.explanation: Proverbs 15:14 contrasts the understanding and foolish man.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:7, what shall the just man do?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:7 says the just man walketh in his integrity.
